detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Students may only register for one required course activity per lecture/lab/discussion or waitlist if there is no space available. Students will be removed from the waitlist if they already have a spot in a section of the course.  For example, students may not register for multiple labs or discussion, including their respective waitlists.  BEING ON THE WAITLIST DOES NOT GUARANTEE YOU A SPACE IN THE LECTURE, LAB, OR DISSCUSSION.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Students may only register for one required course activity per lecture/lab/discussion or waitlist if there is no space available. Students will be removed from the waitlist if they already have a spot in a section of the course. For example, students may not register for BIOL121 section 121 and also be on the waitlist for section 122. BEING ON THE WAITLIST DOES NOT GUARANTEE YOU A SPACE IN THE COURSE.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Course title: "Introduction to Reading and Research in Literary, Cultural, and Media Studies."

This course is part of the Coordinated Arts Program, Environment and Society stream, https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/streams/environment-society/. Students must register in both Term 1 and Term 2 courses in CAP, and must register in the same section (i.e. timeslot) for both CAP 100 and CAP 101 (e.g. CAP_V 100-E02 in Term 1, and CAP_V 101-E02 in Term 2).

This course is clustered with GEOG_V 122-299, and HIST_V 106-227. For GEOG_V 122-299, please register in the lecture and one of the following discussion sections: GEOG_V 122-L2V, GEOG_V 122-L2W, GEOG_V 122-L2X, or GEOG_V 122-L2Y. For HIST_V 106-227, please register into the lecture and one of the following discussion sections: HIST_V 106-L1A, HIST_V 106-L1B, or HIST_V 106-L1D. Follow the prompts to register in all stream seminars (1), lectures (2), and tutorials (1-2) each term. For step-by-step instructions, please visit: https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/program/registration/

All Arts and BDes students with first-year standing are eligible to take CAP 100 and CAP 101.

If you encounter any issues with registration into CAP, please contact us at support.fyip@ubc.ca

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Course title: "Introduction to Reading and Research in Literary, Cultural, and Media Studies."

This course is part of the Coordinated Arts Program, Individual and Society stream, https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/streams/individual-society/. Students must register in both Term 1 and Term 2 courses in CAP, and must register in the same section (i.e. timeslot) for both CAP 100 and CAP 101 (e.g. CAP_V 100-I02 in Term 1, and CAP_V 101-I02 in Term 2).

This course is clustered with ECON_V 102-010, and PSYC_V 102-003. For ECON_V 102-010, please register in the lecture, and one of the following discussion sections: ECON_V 102-L8A, or ECON_V 102-L8B. PSYC_V 102-003, and CAP_V 101 do not have any additional discussion sections. Follow the prompts to register in all stream seminars (1), lectures (2), and tutorials (1) each term. For step-by-step instructions, please visit: https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/program/registration/

All Arts students with first-year standing are eligible to take CAP 100 and CAP 101.

If you encounter any issues with registration into CAP, please contact us at support.fyip@ubc.ca

Students must register in both Term 1 and Term 2 courses in CAP, and must register in the same section (i.e. timeslot) for both CAP 100 and CAP 101 (e.g. CAP_V 100-M02 in Term 1, and CAP_V 101-M02 in Term 2).

This course is clustered with JRNL_V 100-A_227, and VISA_V 110_227. For VISA_V 110_227, please register in the lecture and one of the following studio sections: VISA_V 110-L21, VISA_V 110-L22, VISA_V 110-L23, VISA_V 110-L24, or VISA_V 110-L25. JRNL_V 100-A_227, and CAP_V 101 do not ​have any additional studio/discussion sections. Follow the prompts to register in all stream seminars (1), lectures (2), and tutorials (1) each term. For step-by-step instructions, please visit: https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/program/registration/

All Arts, BMS and BFA students with first-year standing are eligible to take CAP 100 and CAP 101.

If you encounter any issues with registration into CAP, please contact us at support.fyip@ubc.ca

detailResultFields.value:
Course title: "Introduction to Reading and Research in Literary, Cultural, and Media Studies."

This course is part of the Coordinated Arts Program, Media Studies stream, https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/streams/media-studies/. Students must register in both Term 1 and Term 2 courses in CAP, and must register in the same section (i.e. timeslot) for both CAP 100 and CAP 101 (e.g. CAP_V 100-M02 in Term 1, and CAP_V 101-M02 in Term 2).

This course is clustered with JRNL_V 100-A_227, and VISA_V 110_227. For VISA_V 110_227, please register in the lecture and one of the following studio sections: VISA_V 110-L21, VISA_V 110-L22, VISA_V 110-L23, VISA_V 110-L24, or VISA_V 110-L25. JRNL_V 100-A_227, and CAP_V 101 do not ​have any additional studio/discussion sections. Follow the prompts to register in all stream seminars (1), lectures (2), and tutorials (1) each term. For step-by-step instructions, please visit: https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/program/registration/

All Arts, BMS and BFA students with first-year standing are eligible to take CAP 100 and CAP 101.

If you encounter any issues with registration into CAP, please contact us at support.fyip@ubc.ca

Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
